channels.summary: Channel activity focused on sharing academic OSINT articles, labs, and discussions about research integrity and security.

highlights.title: Reuters Institute article on Israel–Hamas war and open-source reporting
highlights.details: Article from the Reuters Institute analysing how the Israel–Hamas war highlights both the power and the limits of open-source reporting for journalism and conflict analysis.

highlights.title: AI agent that defeats online research surveys
highlights.details: 404 Media piece on a research project where an AI agent completed online scientific surveys while evading bot detection 99.8% of the time, raising concerns that survey-based research can be systematically poisoned by AI-generated responses.

highlights.title: Utrecht University Open-Source Global Justice Investigations Lab
highlights.details: Link to Utrecht University’s lab focused on open-source investigations for global justice, relevant for students and researchers interested in OSINT applications in law and accountability.

highlights.title: Queen's Belfast programme with GLAN on global legal advocacy
highlights.details: Information about a Queen’s University Belfast School of Law programme in collaboration with GLAN, relevant for those interested in legal strategies around open-source evidence and accountability.

highlights.title: e-IR article on Estonia’s small-state security strategy
highlights.details: Analysis piece discussing Estonia’s national and regional security interests as a small state facing an existential threat from Russia, and how its security posture may evolve in a darker European security environment.

highlights.title: Terry Tao on reports about research suspension at UCLA
highlights.details: Discussion around unverified claims that Terence Tao’s research was being suspended due to a political crackdown, with a follow-up sharing Tao’s own Mastodon post as primary confirmation.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Stage Talk RSS feed
highlights.details: RSS feed for Bellingcat’s Stage Talk audio recordings, useful for integrating OSINT-related talks into podcast apps for academic or teaching use.

mentions: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
Queen's University Belfast School of Law
US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD)

channels.summary: Weekly server updates and official Bellingcat announcements on new investigations, stage talks, challenges, and structural changes to discussion spaces.

highlights.title: Stage Talk on funding open-source investigations with Mareike Vitt
highlights.details: Announcement of a Stage Talk featuring Bellingcat’s fundraiser Mareike Vitt on how to fund independent open-source research projects, including tips on setting up your own Bellingcat-style effort.

highlights.title: Investigation into federal enforcement actions in Washington, DC
highlights.details: Summary of Bellingcat’s work documenting 42 verified encounters between federal agents and civilians in DC in under a month, including instances involving DC police and detentions stemming from traffic stops.

highlights.title: Stage Talk: Identifying Explosive Ordnance
highlights.details: Announcement and recording link for a Stage Talk on identifying explosive ordnance and understanding the current landscape of EO use in conflicts, aimed at improving OSINT skills around munitions recognition.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Challenges platform
highlights.details: Repeated promotion of Bellingcat’s challenge platform with new OSINT puzzles and an invitation to share methodologies and solutions in the server, encouraging skill-building and collaborative learning.

highlights.title: Investigation into Saudi grain imports from sanctioned Crimean port
highlights.details: Announcement of an investigation, in partnership with Lloyd’s List, uncovering that Saudi Arabia imported grain via Russia’s shadow fleet directly from a sanctioned port in occupied Crimea.

highlights.title: Stage Talk with DoubleThinkLab on Foreign Information Manipulation and Interference
highlights.details: Promotion of an upcoming Stage Talk featuring Jasper Hewitt of DoubleThinkLab, focused on monitoring inauthentic accounts and deep-dive FIMI investigations, and training for journalists and disinformation researchers.

highlights.title: Stage Talk with Space4Good on geospatial monitoring
highlights.details: Follow-up note on a Stage Talk with Lisa Broekhuizen from Space4Good discussing remote sensing and geospatial tools for open-source monitoring, alongside an update that an Online Monitoring Office Hour was cancelled.

highlights.title: Dedicated Epstein discussion forum for harm reduction
highlights.details: Announcement that Epstein-related discussion has been moved into a dedicated, mute-able forum thread to reduce harm and allow survivors or others to avoid the content while maintaining space for OSINT discussion.

highlights.title: Open-source cold case murder investigation presentation
highlights.details: Promotion of a YouTube talk by Bellingcat researcher Peter Barth on using open-source methods to investigate decades-old murders involving organised crime and gambling.

highlights.title: Call for wildlife and environmental OSINT investigations
highlights.details: Bellingcat call for high-quality environment and wildlife investigations using open source methods, open to non-journalists provided the work meets international investigative standards and fact-checking requirements.

highlights.title: Illinois ICE raids investigation with Evident Media
highlights.details: Announcement of a joint investigation with Evident Media on Illinois immigration raids and use of force, providing a link to a detailed article aimed at readers wanting to understand enforcement tactics.

channels.summary: Light but relevant activity on aerial and island geolocation tasks in the Asia-Pacific region.

highlights.title: Chinese airship/balloon infrastructure geolocation
highlights.details: Mention of interesting airship/balloon facilities in remote areas of China, with reference to a hangar and mooring pole as potential OSINT targets for further geolocation and analysis.

highlights.title: Myanmar offshore islands comparison task
highlights.details: Shared link to a Discord message inviting users to compare two islands off Myanmar’s coast, suggesting a geolocation or change-detection exercise.

channels.summary: Channel focused on art theft, cultural property trafficking, heritage investigations, and new archival resources for researchers.

highlights.title: Louvre surveillance password leak incident
highlights.details: Article about a theft at the Louvre where the surveillance system password reportedly being 'louvre' exposed major security failings and caused a crisis at the museum.

highlights.title: Harvard Law School Nuremberg Trials digital collection
highlights.details: Announcement that Harvard Law School Library has made fully searchable, digitized evidentiary documents and transcripts from all 13 Nuremberg Trials available online, a key resource for WWII-era provenance and claims research.

highlights.title: Europol-coordinated crackdown on cultural goods trafficking in Bulgaria
highlights.details: Notice of a major operation in Bulgaria, supported by Europol, that dismantled a criminal network trafficking cultural goods across Europe and beyond, with 35 arrests reported.

highlights.title: IFAR publications now free on Internet Archive
highlights.details: Announcement that the International Foundation for Art Research (IFAR) has made its formerly paywalled publications freely accessible via Internet Archive, providing rich pre-digital data for attribution, provenance, and art-crime research.

highlights.title: US disbands cultural property investigation unit
highlights.details: Denver Post article reporting that agents from Homeland Security’s Cultural Property, Art and Antiquities program have been reassigned to immigration enforcement, weakening US leadership in cultural heritage investigations.

highlights.title: Sentences in theft of 16th century Chinese vase from Musée royal de Mariemont
highlights.details: Summary of a Charleroi Criminal Court judgment sentencing nine defendants to prison (some suspended) in connection with an April 2024 burglary and theft of a 16th century Chinese vase; one minor defendant avoided prison.

channels.summary: Discussion of regional politics, human rights, and transnational crime in the Asia-Pacific, alongside meta-discussion on antisemitism and criticism of Israel.

highlights.title: NYT article on Chinese general tied to Tiananmen Square
highlights.details: Link to a New York Times piece examining a Chinese general connected to Tiananmen Square, relevant to contemporary Chinese politics and military leadership.

highlights.title: Distinguishing antisemitism from criticism of Israel
highlights.details: Participants discuss how opposition to Israeli state policies is often conflated with antisemitism, citing Neturei Karta and Satmar Hasidic rabbis and Joel Teitelbaum as examples of Jewish critics of Zionism.

highlights.title: Deportation of Cambodian tycoon Chen Zhi (Prince Group) to China
highlights.details: Article on Chen Zhi, founder of Prince Holding Group, being deported to China amid allegations of profiting from human trafficking, pig-butchering scams, and forced labor linked to about US$10 billion in fraud.

channels.summary: Sharing of tools, techniques, and news related to flight tracking, safety, and government aircraft operations.

highlights.title: CPA SkyCircles for replaying resolution advisory (RA) incidents
highlights.details: Demonstration of using cpa.skycircl.es with a provided KML file to visualise a near mid-air resolution advisory, including using the Closest Approaches tab and enabling position reports to see radar hits during the event.

highlights.title: ProPublica investigation on SpaceX, FAA, and airline safety
highlights.details: Shared ProPublica article on how SpaceX launches and FAA oversight intersect with airline safety, particularly around launch debris and risk to commercial aviation in Florida and the Caribbean.

highlights.title: Using Airnav Radar and ADS-B Exchange to infer blocked flight destinations
highlights.details: Tip that Airnav Radar (with subscription) can show filed flight plan routes for otherwise blocked aircraft; combining this with ADS-B Exchange can reveal origin, destination, and routing even when some flight details are hidden.

highlights.title: Limits of tracking DHS/ICE helicopters via public ADS-B sites
highlights.details: Explanation that common tracking platforms (Flightradar24, FlightAware, ADS-B Exchange) often cannot show DHS helicopters if transponders are off, noting that DHS rotary aircraft are known to fly at low altitude without transponders.

highlights.title: TRT World article relevant to Indonesian Air Force/aviation
highlights.details: Shared TRT World article (also posted in the munitions channel) about Indonesian air capabilities, used as context in a discussion about the Indonesian Air Force potentially moving towards domestic aircraft production.

channels.summary: Brief discussion about missile spoofing, Indonesian air capabilities, and updates to the Open Source Munitions Portal.

highlights.title: Spoofing of Kinzhal missile guidance
highlights.details: Comment noting that in certain cases the content (like a song) used in a clip is irrelevant but serves propaganda value, and remarking that the Russian Kinzhal missile appears surprisingly easy to spoof.

highlights.title: New images on Open Source Munitions Portal from US raid to capture Maduro
highlights.details: Notification that images of munitions used during a US raid to capture Maduro have been added to the Open Source Munitions Portal, with a link to the update via X/Twitter mirror.

highlights.title: TRT World piece on Indonesian air force plans
highlights.details: Article shared (also in #aviation) discussing the Indonesian Air Force’s current trajectory and the possibility of it moving towards producing its own aircraft.

channels.summary: Sharing of military mapping resources and analysis on narratives and troop movements in the Caucasus and Central Asia.

highlights.title: Oxus Society Tajikistan military units visualisation
highlights.details: Link to an Oxus Society interactive visualisation of Tajikistan’s military units, useful for mapping force structure and locations in Central Asia.

highlights.title: Upcoming interactive map of 620+ Uzbek military facilities
highlights.details: Announcement that an interactive dataset containing the locations of over 620 military facilities in Uzbekistan is nearly ready for release, promising a detailed open-source mapping tool.

highlights.title: DFRLab report on 'biolabs' narratives in Armenia
highlights.details: Commentary on a DFRLab report showing how Russian-style 'biolabs' disinformation narratives used in Ukraine are now being applied to Armenia, targeting entities like CDC and USAID and even scientific conferences.

highlights.title: Russian troop buildup in Armenia amid tensions with Azerbaijan
highlights.details: Euromaidan Press article describing intelligence reports that Moscow is accelerating troop deployments in Armenia as tensions with Azerbaijan rise.

highlights.title: Clarification on peace deal status via Clash Report tweet
highlights.details: Explanation that a referenced peace deal was only 'initialed' rather than fully signed and ratified, based on a source post from Clash Report.

mentions: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

channels.summary: Updates to completed Ukraine geolocation entries, including precise coordinates for conflict damage in Kherson.

highlights.title: Geolocation of damage in Kozats'ke & Vesele, Kherson (ID 2547)
highlights.details: Post confirming geolocation for residential damage in Kozats'ke and Vesele, Kherson, with multiple images tied to precise coordinates and a Google Maps satellite view plus original Telegram source.

channels.summary: Meta-discussion of Bellingcat projects, Stage Talks, tools, and new distribution channels.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Toolkit one-year milestone
highlights.details: Announcement that the updated Bellingcat Toolkit has turned one year old, highlighting it as a curated collection of OSINT tools with use cases, guidance, and honest reviews maintained by community volunteers.

highlights.title: Stage Talks with Bellingcat podcast recordings
highlights.details: Multiple posts linking Stage Talk episodes (e.g., on explosive ordnance, far-right fashion, extremism identifications, immigration raids, and 'sketchy boats') available via an RSS feed and major podcast platforms.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Annual Report 2024
highlights.details: Link to Bellingcat’s 2024 annual report outlining key investigations, impact, and lessons learned, available as a downloadable PDF.

highlights.title: Bellingcat WhatsApp channel
highlights.details: Announcement that Bellingcat now runs a WhatsApp channel for direct distribution of updates to users who prefer messaging apps over other social media.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Challenges portal
highlights.details: Quick link drop to the Bellingcat Challenges site for those looking to practice OSINT skills through structured puzzles.

highlights.title: Patreon-exclusive podcast on Bellingcat volunteer community
highlights.details: Link to a Patreon-only podcast episode offering a behind-the-scenes look at Bellingcat’s volunteer community and how it contributes to investigations.

channels.summary: Resources and discussion on the economics of online manipulation, military information operations, and media framing of misinformation-related stories.

highlights.title: Science paper: Mapping the online manipulation economy
highlights.details: Shared Science article and associated social posts discussing a framework for understanding digital manipulation as a market, with potential implications for improving online trust and safety.

highlights.title: Danish linguist job posting likely tied to SOCOM info ops
highlights.details: A GDIT Danish linguist vacancy is flagged as almost certainly supporting US Special Operations Command information operations targeting Danish media and Greenland, illustrating contracting pathways for influence work.

highlights.title: Ars Technica piece on why some people stick with misinformation
highlights.details: Article arguing that believing misinformation can be psychologically rewarding for some individuals even when it’s disproven, relevant to understanding persistence of false narratives.

highlights.title: Critique of misleading Rolling Stone headline
highlights.details: Bluesky posts analysing a Rolling Stone article where the headline is described as highly misleading relative to the content, highlighting how framing can distort audience perception even when text is more nuanced.

highlights.title: Locating Sora AI video watermark
highlights.details: Short technical note that certain text areas in a frame are where the Sora watermark is typically placed, relevant for trying to detect or crop AI-generated video watermarks.

channels.summary: Key update on a major remote-sensing fire monitoring tool and a climate-biodiversity news item, plus a new member introduction focused on animal exploitation investigations.

highlights.title: NASA FIRMS data update suspension notice
highlights.details: Alert that NASA FIRMS now carries a notice stating it is no longer updating the fire monitoring map due to lack of federal funding, which significantly impacts OSINT workflows relying on near-real-time fire detections.

highlights.title: Mosquitoes confirmed in Iceland due to warming climate
highlights.details: Guardian article reporting the first detection of mosquitoes in Iceland, attributed to the climate crisis warming the country, with implications for ecosystem change and vector-borne disease risks.
